LBP - A Modern and Dynamic Law Firm

blog2Title2: Why Internal Labor Regulations are a Must for every Business with Employees?
blog2Title5: Why Are ILRs So Important for Businesses?
blog2Title6: What If You Don’t Have ILRs?
blog2Text1: Internal Labor Regulations (ILRs) are an essential foundation for any business that employs staff.  Despite their critical importance, ILRs often remain undervalued. As a result, till to this day companies operate without having them at all or in place.
blog2Text2: ILRs play essential role in creating a strong workplace as due to these regulations employees clearly understand their responsibilities and work ethic, creating transparency and safety in the work environment. Beyond fostering a positive workplace culture, ILRs serve a vital function in legal contexts - courts rely on them as for litigation to assess the fairness and legality of employer actions.
blog2Text3: As you establish a business and you begin to hire employees, having a well-structured internal labor regulation (ILR) document is not a mere formality – it is a necessity.
blog2Text4: From a startup to a large commercial entity, workplace rules protect your business, promote equality, and prevent legal risks.
blog2Text5: Internal labor regulations are formal documents that define the rules and procedures regulating workplace behavior, parties’ responsibilities, disciplinary measures, working ethic, health/safety measurements, and other important aspects of the employment relationship.
blog2Text6: ILRs can be customized based on your company’s capacity, work field, internal culture, and aims. However, they usually cover:
blog2Ul1Li6: Working hours, rest breaks and vacation rules
blog2Text7: Having these matters in writing will assist you and your employees to create an organized, predictable, and professional work environment. The latter will have a positive impact on your future goals, success and growth.
blog2Ul2Text1: Without ILRs, commercial ccompanies face greater risk to labor disputes and legal instability. For instance, if an employee files a complaint or a labor inspection reviews your labor practices, not having internal work regulations can be viewed as a sign of poor or ineffective management. Thus, ILRs serve as a legal safeguard showcasing your company’s fairness and transparent work standard.
blog2Ul2Text2: ILRs is a guarantee to prevent misunderstandings by setting employee rights and obligations in written. When parties to a labor agreement have the right expectations, the risk of disputes is minimized, and workplace harmony improves.
blog2Ul2Text3: ILRs can strengthen your position in dismissal or disciplinary actions by showing that employees were informed about the rules and treated accordingly. It is established practice that courts and labor inspectors refer to internal regulations while reviewing the legality of an employer’s actions.
blog2Ul2Text4: Internal labor rules demonstrate your company’s professionalism, strong leadership manners, managerial competence and compliance with law.  It helps to build a workplace culture and promotes values of responsibility and integrity.

blog1Text1: Until 2023, Georgian legislation did not recognize the concept of cryptocurrency, which is now defined as a 'virtual asset.' As a result of recent amendments, cryptocurrency was recognized as a virtual asset, and its definition was established by a decree from the President of the National Bank of Georgia. According to this definition, a virtual asset is a digital representation of value that is interchangeable and not unique, used for transfer or trade in a digital format, and intended for investment and/or making payments.
blog1Text2: The decree also clarifies that a virtual asset does not include a digital representation of money, securities, or other financial instruments. For example, the Georgian lari cannot be represented as a virtual asset.
blog1Text3: It is also interesting to consider what is meant by services related to virtual assets. Simply put, this refers to activities associated with convertible virtual assets, meaning digital assets that have monetary value and can be used in various forms. Examples of such services include: currency or asset exchange — exchanging virtual assets for national or foreign currency, other virtual assets, or financial instruments; secure storage and administration of virtual assets for future use; and management of trading platforms — creation and administration of platforms for buying and selling virtual assets.
blog1Text4: Additionally, the legislative changes allow for the provision of virtual assets on loan. This could be of interest to companies that already own virtual assets and wish to increase their financial resources without selling them. However, such activities come with certain business risks that should be assessed based on the company's internal policies and resources.
blog1Text5: Given the specific nature of providing these services, it is logical that anyone engaged in the storage, trading, or other operations involving virtual assets must meet certain requirements. Under the new legislation, the right to provide such services is granted to the 'virtual asset service provider' — a legal entity registered under Georgian law, which provides services not for its own benefit, but on behalf of other parties. The responsibility for registration and supervision of service providers lies with the National Bank of Georgia.
blog1Text6: Those wishing to register as a provider, cancel registration, or make changes such as the location of the main office must contact the National Bank. To register, the provider must submit documentation regulated by the decree of the President of the National Bank of Georgia “On the Approval of Rules for the Registration and Regulation of Payment Service Providers.” The National Bank makes a decision on registration within 60 days, and the registration fee is 5,000 GEL.
blog1Text7: The legislative changes also clearly state that the regulation of virtual assets is linked to the prevention of money laundering in Georgia. According to the National Bank's requirements, providers are required to have internal policies for the prevention of money laundering and the financing of terrorism. Before starting operations, the provider must confirm the existence of such a system or implement it before working with virtual assets. This makes sense given that virtual assets are often used in transactions that are more difficult to monitor and regulate compared to traditional financial systems. For example, small transactions involving virtual assets often remain outside the control and attention of traditional mechanisms.
blog1Text8: Since the regulations governing the virtual asset services sector came into effect last year, many questions have arisen in everyday practice. The National Bank of Georgia is striving to tightly control the use of virtual assets by setting specific frameworks for providers, which helps ensure transparency and security in the financial system.
blog1Text9: For example, Can a person accept virtual assets as payment for goods or services? Are transactions using virtual assets legal within Georgia? Answering: Transactions using virtual assets are prohibited in Georgia, except for special cases defined by the National Bank. For example, a service provider cannot accept cryptocurrency as direct payment for their products or services. However, a virtual asset service provider has the right to charge a fee in the same virtual asset they are working with.

textFounder1:
Giorgi Shalamberidze is the founder and Managing Partner of LBP Law Office.

His professional journey includes prior roles at PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), one of the Big Four firms, as well as positions with the Georgian Young Lawyers Association, Tbilisi State University, and the J&T Consulting educational centre.
Giorgi’s practice focuses on complex litigation, criminal defense, private wealth management, digital assets, and technology law.

He is admitted to the Georgian Bar Association and is an active member of a leading Georgian policy think tank, combining deep legal expertise with strategic policy insight.
He graduated from Tbilisi State University in 2020 and earned an LL.M. from Georgetown University Law Center in 2023 in Washington, D.C., having received full-tuition scholarships for both degrees in recognition of his academic excellence.

Giorgi has represented clients from all over the world including North America, Western Europe, East Asia, Latin America, Eastern Europe, Central Asia and Australia.
His notable engagements include:
  • Serving as counsel to one of Georgia’s premier brandy producers;
  • Advising the Georgian padel and fencing federations;
  • Representing one of the country’s leading publishing houses;
  • Advising investors from Canada, France, Spain, and Poland in major real-estate acquisitions;
  • Structuring cross-border estates for U.S. clients;
  • Litigating complex corporate disputes for a multinational corporation operating across more than a dozen jurisdictions.

Outside his legal practice, Giorgi maintains a strong interest in architecture and is an avid traveler, continuously exploring new countries.

faqQ1: How do I schedule a consultation with LBP?
faqA1: You can schedule a consultation by emailing us at info@lbp.ge, calling +995-595-223-333, or reaching out via WhatsApp or Telegram. We typically respond within one business day.
faqQ2: What areas of law does LBP cover?
faqA2: LBP covers 15+ practice areas including corporate law, criminal law, labor law, crypto and digital assets, IP and personal data, investment and real estate, litigation, sports law, and more.
faqQ3: Does LBP work with international clients?
faqA3: Yes. LBP has represented clients from North America, Western Europe, East Asia, Latin America, Eastern Europe, Central Asia, and Australia. We are experienced in cross-border matters.
faqQ4: What are your fees and payment structure?
faqA4: Our fees depend on the type and complexity of the legal matter. We offer flexible billing arrangements including fixed fees, hourly rates, and retainer agreements. Contact us for a personalized quote.
faqQ5: Do you offer services in English?
faqA5: Absolutely. Our team is fluent in English and Georgian. We regularly draft documents, conduct negotiations, and represent clients in English across all practice areas.
faqQ6: How long does a typical legal matter take?
faqA6: Timelines vary depending on the matter. Simple consultations can be completed in days, while complex litigation or corporate transactions may take several months. We provide realistic time estimates during your initial consultation.
